summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Reports feature with date range filtering (daily/weekly/monthly). Found and fixed critical Excel generation bug. All backend API tests (29/29) and frontend UI tests pass.

critical.issue: FIXED - AttributeError: 'MergedCell' object has no attribute 'column_letter' when generating Excel reports
critical.fix: Added MergedCell filtering in column width adjustment loop at line 550-557 in server.py

passed_tests: Reports page loads with all UI elements
Report Type selection (Full, Daily, Weekly, Monthly) works
Daily report auto-sets date range to today (2026-02-21)
Weekly report auto-sets date range to this week
Monthly report auto-sets date range to this month
Phase filter dropdown works with all phases
Status filter dropdown works with all statuses
Include Update History toggle works
Excel format selection works
PDF format selection works
Download button generates and downloads Excel report
Download button generates and downloads PDF report
GET /api/reports/generate accepts format=excel
GET /api/reports/generate accepts format=pdf
GET /api/reports/generate accepts report_type parameter
GET /api/reports/generate accepts start_date and end_date parameters
GET /api/reports/generate accepts phase filter parameter
GET /api/reports/generate accepts status filter parameter
GET /api/reports/generate accepts include_history parameter
Report filename includes report type (Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Full)
Report filename includes date
Excel reports contain multiple sheets (Summary, At Risk, Delayed, History)
PDF reports contain metadata header with filters applied
Combined filters work correctly
updated_files: /app/backend/server.py - Fixed MergedCell bug in generate_excel_enhanced function (line 550-557)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Reports feature fully tested. Fixed critical Excel generation bug caused by MergedCell objects in column iteration. Backend API supports: report_type (full/daily/weekly/monthly), start_date, end_date, phase, status, include_history parameters. Frontend auto-calculates date ranges based on report type. Both Excel (.xlsx) and PDF exports working correctly.

rca_of_issue.root_cause: The generate_excel_enhanced function at line 452 merges cells A1:K1 for the title. When iterating over columns at line 553 to adjust column widths, the code accessed col[0].column_letter on all cells. MergedCell objects (created by merge_cells) don't have the column_letter attribute, causing AttributeError.
rca_of_issue.fix_applied: Added filtering to skip MergedCell objects when iterating columns: from openpyxl.cell.cell import MergedCell; valid_cells = [c for c in col if not isinstance(c, MergedCell)]
rca_of_issue.impact: Excel report generation was completely broken (500 Internal Server Error). PDF reports were unaffected.
